intro: Tetracera demeusei, commonly known as the Demeuse's tetracera, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and is often found in lowland rainforest habitats. It typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
